A history of Defend Harlem

1957

1954

1940s

1940s: Morningside Heights Incorporated is created by Nicholas Butler to create a buffer between Columbia and Black and Latino communities

1987

1970s

1970: The Harlem Urban Development Corporation is founded, contributing to the community through revitalizing brownstones, 125th Street, proposing the “Harlem on the Hudson” project, and more

1990s

1998: The HUDC is shut down by Governor Pataki, leaving a gap in advocacy for the community

2005

2001-2013: Bloomberg rezones 40 percent of New York City, causing migration in Midtown Manhattan populations

2000s

2011: Dr. Charles Curtis and Dedrick Blue form the New York Interfaith Commission

2010s

2005
